channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9185] mvn site target fails when building with Maven 3.1
item.description:
mvn site fails when building with mvn 3.1 due to various class changes inside maven. They promise that switching to new versions of some mvn modules will result in builds that work in both 3.0.x and 3.1:

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/AetherClassNotFound
item.environment:
Apache Maven 3.1.0 (893ca28a1da9d5f51ac03827af98bb730128f9f2; 2013-06-27 19:15:32-0700)
Java version: 1.6.0_51, vendor: Apple Inc.
Java home: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/1.6.0_51-b11-457.jdk/Contents/Home
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: MacRoman
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.8.4", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"
item.summary: mvn site target fails when building with Maven 3.1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

BTW, the command that failed was


mvn clean install -DskipTests javadoc:aggregate site assembly:single
Update site plugin and info-reports-plugins as per the page Steve posts in the description. Makes site work for me w/ 3.1. Going to commit.
Committed to 0.95 and trunk. Thanks for reporting the issue Steve (What you doing messing w/ mvn!).
